channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: Climate Caucus Successfully Courts More Congressional Republicans
item.description: June 14, 2017 - For years, a grassroots group has been lobbying Congress to do something on climate change. Suddenly, since Trump took office, they're winning over a growing number of House Republicans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 14, 2017 - For years, a grassroots group has been lobbying Congress to do something on climate change. Suddenly, since Trump took office, they're winning over a growing number of House Republicans. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/14/532969087/climate-caucus-successfully-courts-more-congressional-republicans

item.title: Medicaid Cuts In Wisconsin Would Undermine Training For Adults With Disabilities
item.description: June 14, 2017 - Job-coaching and other support services that enable many adults to live in the community instead of institutions will likely be curtailed if the GOP plan to shrink Medicaid becomes law.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 14, 2017 - Job-coaching and other support services that enable many adults to live in the community instead of institutions will likely be curtailed if the GOP plan to shrink Medicaid becomes law. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/14/531928586/medicaid-cuts-in-wisconsin-would-undermine-training-for-adults-with-disabilities

item.title: Will Fish Get A Humanely Harvested Label? These Brothers Bet $40 Million On It
item.description: June 14, 2017 - Beef and poultry get labels designating humane treatment; seafood doesn't. Two fishermen want to change that. Their state-of-the-art ship makes fishing safer for crew and minimizes pain for fish.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 14, 2017 - Beef and poultry get labels designating humane treatment; seafood doesn't. Two fishermen want to change that. Their state-of-the-art ship makes fishing safer for crew and minimizes pain for fish. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/14/532845573/will-fish-get-a-humanely-harvested-label-these-brothers-bet-40-million-on-it

item.title: Brain Cell Transplants Are Being Tested Once Again For Parkinson's
item.description: June 13, 2017 - In 2003, researchers declared a moratorium on the use of transplanted brain cells to treat Parkinson's disease. Now, armed with better cells, they're giving the approach another try.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - In 2003, researchers declared a moratorium on the use of transplanted brain cells to treat Parkinson's disease. Now, armed with better cells, they're giving the approach another try. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/13/532792500/brain-cell-transplants-are-being-tested-once-again-for-parkinsons

item.title: What's The Difference Between Famine And Hunger? A Food FAQ
item.description: June 13, 2017 - We asked our readers what they wanted to know about world hunger? So many thoughtful questions came in that we did a roundup of queries about hunger and famine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - We asked our readers what they wanted to know about world hunger? So many thoughtful questions came in that we did a roundup of queries about hunger and famine. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/13/532277316/what-s-the-difference-between-famine-and-hunger-a-food-faq

item.title: Police Shootings: How A Culture Of Racism Can Infect Us All
item.description: June 13, 2017 - In a shooting involving a police officer, there's often a familiar blame game: Was the cop was racist? Was the person shot threatening? Or maybe, the bias that leads cops to shoot affects us all.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 13, 2017 - In a shooting involving a police officer, there's often a familiar blame game: Was the cop was racist? Was the person shot threatening? Or maybe, the bias that leads cops to shoot affects us all. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/13/532724743/police-shootings-how-a-culture-of-racism-can-infect-us-all

item.title: Rap on Trial: How An Aspiring Musician's Words Led To Prison Time
item.description: June 12, 2017 - Olutosin Oduwole was a college student and aspiring rapper when he was charged with "attempting to make a terrorist threat." We explore how perceptions of rap music may have played a role.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - Olutosin Oduwole was a college student and aspiring rapper when he was charged with "attempting to make a terrorist threat." We explore how perceptions of rap music may have played a role. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/12/532633692/rap-on-trial-how-an-aspiring-musicians-words-led-to-prison-time

item.title: Dog Owners Walk 22 Minutes More Per Day. And Yes, It Counts As Exercise
item.description: June 12, 2017 - A new study finds dog owners on average walk 22 more minutes more per day compared to people without dogs. The benefits of walking include a lower risk of heart disease and premature death.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - A new study finds dog owners on average walk 22 more minutes more per day compared to people without dogs. The benefits of walking include a lower risk of heart disease and premature death. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/12/532625213/dog-owners-walk-22-minutes-more-per-day-and-yes-it-counts-as-exercise

item.title: Another Federal Appeals Court Says Trump's Travel Ban Should Remain On Hold
item.description: June 12, 2017 - The 9th Circuit largely upheld an injunction that blocks key portions of the president's revised travel ban from going into effect. The 4th Circuit upheld a similar injunction weeks ago.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - The 9th Circuit largely upheld an injunction that blocks key portions of the president's revised travel ban from going into effect. The 4th Circuit upheld a similar injunction weeks ago. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/12/532620714/another-federal-appeals-court-says-trumps-travel-ban-should-remain-on-hold

item.title: How To Apply The Brain Science Of Resilience To The Classroom
item.description:
June 12, 2017 - A nonprofit called Turnaround for Children helps schools meet the needs of children facing poverty and adversity.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/06/12/530893427/how-to-apply-the-brain-science-of-resilience-to-the-classroom

item.title: Is Zika Still A Problem In Florida And The Caribbean?
item.description: June 12, 2017 - The Zika outbreak in Florida is officially over. And cases are dropping across the Caribbean. But doctors say the risk to pregnant women there — whether residents or travelers — isn't gone.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 12, 2017 - The Zika outbreak in Florida is officially over. And cases are dropping across the Caribbean. But doctors say the risk to pregnant women there — whether residents or travelers — isn't gone. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/12/531949066/is-zika-still-a-problem-in-florida-and-the-caribbean

item.title: The Triumphs And Perils Of 'Going Big'
item.description: June 11, 2017 - Don Laub was a pioneering surgeon — one of the first in the U.S. to perform gender reassignment surgeries, but tragedy came when he traveled to Mexico to provide free surgeries to children.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 11, 2017 - Don Laub was a pioneering surgeon — one of the first in the U.S. to perform gender reassignment surgeries, but tragedy came when he traveled to Mexico to provide free surgeries to children. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/11/532503056/what-happens-when-a-leaders-vision-is-the-wrong-one

item.title: Meet Your Lucky Stars: NASA Announces A New Class Of Astronaut Candidates
item.description: June 11, 2017 - This year was one of the most competitive applicant pools in the agency's history. One of the candidates explains what it takes to earn a coveted spot — and why so many want to be an astronaut today.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 11, 2017 - This year was one of the most competitive applicant pools in the agency's history. One of the candidates explains what it takes to earn a coveted spot — and why so many want to be an astronaut today. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/11/532249940/meet-your-lucky-stars-nasa-announces-a-new-class-of-astronaut-candidates

item.title: How Climate Data Is Collected
item.description: June 11, 2017 - President Trump's proposed budget would cut money for climate research that measures a warming world. We tag along to see how air samples are collected on a Colorado mountaintop.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 11, 2017 - President Trump's proposed budget would cut money for climate research that measures a warming world. We tag along to see how air samples are collected on a Colorado mountaintop. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/11/532457904/how-climate-data-is-collected

item.title: GOP's Proposed Cuts To Medicaid Threaten Treatment For Opioid Addiction
item.description: June 11, 2017 - Expanding Medicaid has helped many people caught up in the opioid epidemic get treatment. But doctors say the proposed Republican changes to the Affordable Care Act could jeopardize these programs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 11, 2017 - Expanding Medicaid has helped many people caught up in the opioid epidemic get treatment. But doctors say the proposed Republican changes to the Affordable Care Act could jeopardize these programs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/11/531214580/gops-proposed-cuts-to-medicaid-threaten-treatment-for-opioid-addiction
